attributes.additional_details: We the People of the United Kingdom of Great Britain & Ireland, demand a General Election to be held immediately in light of the fact that the current Governing Party has thus far been unable to command a majority rule on its negotiated withdrawal from the European Union. We demand that Article 50 be set aside until the elections have been held, only then should negotiations resume.
attributes.background:
Brexit has proved too difficult for just one Parliamentary Party to negotiate a deal for the UK’s withdrawal from the EU.
A General Election is the only sensible option left and a coalition Cross Party Government should be formed to negotiate our withdrawal bill.
